verses.verse: Give ear<WH238>, O Shepherd<WH7462> of Israel<WH3478>, you that lead<WH5090> Joseph<WH3130> like a flock<WH6629>; you that live<WH3427> between the cherubims<WH3742>, shine forth<WH3313>.
Before<WH6440> Ephraim<WH669> and Benjamin<WH1144> and Manasseh<WH4519> stir up<WH5782> your strength<WH1369>, and come<WH3212> and save us<WH3444>.
Turn us again<WH7725>, O God<WH430>, and cause your face<WH6440> to shine<WH215>; and we shall be saved<WH3467>.
O Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>, how long will you be angry<WH6225> against the prayer<WH8605> of your people<WH5971>?
You feed<WH398> them with the bread<WH3899> of tears<WH1832>; and give them tears<WH1832> to drink<WH8248> in great measure<WH7991>.
You make<WH7760> us a strife<WH4066> unto our neighbors<WH7934>: and our enemies<WH341> laugh among themselves<WH3932>.
Turn us again<WH7725>, O God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>, and cause your face<WH6440> to shine<WH215>; and we shall be saved<WH3467>.
You have brought<WH5265> a vine<WH1612> out of Egypt<WH4714>: you have cast out<WH1644> the heathen<WH1471>, and planted it<WH5193>.
You prepared<WH6437> room before<WH6440> it<WH8328>, and did cause it to take deep root<WH8327>, and it filled<WH4390> the land<WH776>.
The hills<WH2022> were covered<WH3680> with the shadow<WH6738> of it<WH6057>, and the boughs there were like the good<WH410> cedars<WH730>.
She sent out<WH7971> her boughs<WH7105> unto the sea<WH3220>, and her branches<WH3127> unto the river<WH5104>.
Why have you then broken down<WH6555> her hedges<WH1447>, so that all they which pass<WH5674> by the way<WH1870> do pluck her<WH717>?
The boar<WH2386> out of the wood<WH3293> does waste<WH3765> it<WH2123>, and the wild animal of the field<WH7704> does devour it<WH7462>.
Return<WH7725>, we beg you<WH430>, O God of hosts<WH6635>: look down<WH5027> from heaven<WH8064>, and behold<WH7200>, and visit<WH6485> this vine<WH1612>;
And the vineyard<WH3657> which your right hand<WH3225> has planted<WH5193>, and the branch<WH1121> that you made strong for yourself<WH553>.
It is burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>, it is cut down<WH3683>: they perish<WH6> at the rebuke<WH1606> of your favor<WH6440>.
Let your hand<WH3027> be upon the man<WH376> of your right hand<WH3225>, upon the son<WH1121> of man<WH120> whom you made strong for yourself<WH553>.
So will not we go back<WH5472> from you<WH2421>: quicken us<WH7121>, and we will call upon your name<WH8034>.
Turn us again<WH7725>, O Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>, cause your face<WH6440> to shine<WH215>; and we shall be saved<WH3467>.
